Welcome to PyParse’s documentation!#

Authors: Joseph Mason, Francesco Rianjongdee, Harry Wilders, David Fallon

Description#

This script carries out an automated analysis of LCMS data in the Waters OpenLynx™ browser report file (.rpt) format, using a .csv platemap to inform which compounds are found in which well of a plate. It was designed specifically for the analysis of data generated from high-throughput chemistry, and is suitable for reaction optimisations, parallel synthesis and library validation experiments.

Example Usage#

Standard Analysis for a 96-Well Plate#
python PyParse.py example_rpt.rpt example_platemap.csv -o new_output_directory -r 8 -c 12 -pt corrP/STD

(Used for an LCMS plate with 8 rows and 12 columns, to generate visualisations based on the corrected ratio of product to internal standard. Saves all output tables/data/visualisations to “new_output_directory”.)
